answers.answer: Thats not a good thing. I would think a doctor could answer that but if you loosing weight you should keep trying to find out whats wrong. You dont want to become sick soo ask more doctors what could it be. Hard to answer your ? but i tried.

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Dehydration is the commonest cause of high count. Drink plenty of fluids and repeat the test after a week. If it is still high, then it could be due to polycythemia vera, low oxygen in blood, or due to a heart condition. Diabetes too could be a cause.It is difficult to comment beyond this at this stage. Do consult your doctor. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: i have an high blood count but iam not sure what the problem is the doctors cant find what is going on it started when i was bit by an insect and i started to lose a bit of weightThis discussion is related to/posts/show/309856.
title: genaral
